txt.en: Into the Dusk
'The size of this paw print is rather alarming. Was this left by the 'Shadow Hunter'? Weapons at the ready, [placeholder].'
Find the missing horse
'Finish any other business you have in the village. Then, we will head into the forest to find Shathur-munzu. Let us see if these 'demons' are real.'
'Whenever you are ready, [placeholder].'
Talk to Baradal
Talk to Baradal
You have found a cart sitting by itself in the road
Find Shathur-munzu
'What is that in the road ahead?'
Talk to Baradal
Suddenly, something leaps from the shadows and takes the horse!
This must be all that remains of the man you sought
TBD
TBD
Baradal is standing by in Arhaim.\n\nWhen you are ready to head into the wilds, you should speak to Baradal.
Shathur-munzu is somewhere west of Arhaim.\n\nYou should start by following the path west from the village.
You have found a cart sitting by itself in the road.\n\nYou should talk to Baradal about this.
Baradal believes the owner of the cart may still be alive somewhere in the forest west of Arhaim.\n\nYou should search for the cart's owner.

'We found him too late. Unfortunate, but he did not heed the warnings of the villagers. I have heard many tales of greed twisting the hearts of Men.'

She realizes she has accidentally insulted you again, and blushes. She quickly changes the subject.

'There must be some evidence nearby as to the identity of the 'demon' who did this. And perhaps the horse who pulled that cart is still alive.'

'This cart is mostly empty, and misses both horse and owner. Someone may have headed toward Shathur-munzu in search of dwarf-gold. These tracks seem fairly recent; perhaps the ones who made them are still alive. We should head into the forest and search for them.'
Baradal can be called to your side with Baradal's summoning horn.\n\nYou should talk to Baradal.
TBD Duskenvale Narrative 3
'How? It was alive just a moment ago!'
Talk to Baradal
The dead cart owner's horse may still be alive somewhere in the forest of Duskenvale.\n\nYou should find the missing horse.

'We found him too late. Unfortunate, but he did not heed the warnings of the villagers. I have heard many tales of greed twisting the hearts of Men.\n\n'There must be some evidence nearby as to the identity of the 'demon' who did this. And perhaps the horse who pulled that cart is still alive.'
Follow the path west from Arhaim
The horse was spooked by your approach and ran deeper into the forest.\n\nYou should find the missing horse again.
Baradal can be called to your side with Baradal's summoning horn.\n\nYou should talk to Baradal about what just occurred.
The horse has been killed!
The horse is startled and runs deeper into the forest
Find the cart's owner
Shathur-munzu can be found west of Arhaim, in the wilds of Duskenvale.\n\nYou should find Shathur-munzu.
'Ah, we frightened it. We must find it again. It is not safe out here.'
'Oh no...'
Armed with the information you need, Baradal wishes to head into the wilds in search of the dwarf ruin Shathur-munzu.
Talk to Baradal
Find the missing horse

Baradal is slightly shaken by the sudden death of the horse.

'We are not alone out here! There are deep claw marks in its hide! Be on guard! The poor horse. He loyally followed his master into danger and met an undeserved fate.

'Wait... look at these tracks! I believe the demons feared by the Woodmen are simply wargs. We are more than capable of handling this threat. We should proceed to Shathur-munzu at once.'
Baradal pauses, alarmed by something ahead
TBD
Baradal can be called to your side with Baradal's summoning horn.\n\nYou should talk to Baradal.
